meanings.definition: To refurbish or repair a product so it can be used again.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic remanufactured the engine to make it run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: They remanufactured the old computer to sell it at a lower price.
meanings.sent3: After he remanufactured the broken toy, it looked brand new!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity remanufactured the dull room into a vibrant space.
meanings.sent5: The artist's touch remanufactured the plain canvas into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A product that has been refurbished or repaired for reuse.
meanings.sent1: The store sells remanufactured printers at a discounted price.
meanings.sent2: I bought a remanufactured phone that works just like new.
meanings.sent3: The remanufactured bicycle was a hit at the garage sale.
meanings.sent4: She proudly showed off her remanufactured laptop to her friends.
meanings.sent5: The remanufactured car engine saved him a lot of money.
